cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 650 miles east of the Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the northern Leeward Islands, then the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Puerto Rico (possible landfall or closest passage across/just south of the island)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time (watches only posted for parts of the northern Leeward Islands east of Puerto Rico)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and eastern Hispaniola are in the projected path
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible at San Juan late Saturday night through Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Building swells and surf with minor coastal inundation (generally below 3 ft) and hazardous rip currents
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deposit 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches, creating flash-flood and mud-slide risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas in the approach channel and berthing areas, dangerous rip currents, and possible debris-flow from upland areas
